original_solution_mapping.L1: We have to know how many MB are 360GB, 360GB x 1,000MB/1GB = <<360000=360000>>360,000 MB
original_solution_mapping.L2: The total seconds downloading will be 360,000MB / 50MB/second = <<360000/50=7200>>7,200 seconds

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6819.
    Returns: the total number of hours Vicky has to wait.
    """
    # L1
    program_size_gb = 360 # The program’s size is 360GB
    mb_per_gb = 1000 # There are 1000 MB per GB
    program_size_mb = program_size_gb * mb_per_gb

    # L2
    download_speed_mbps = 50 # 50 MB/second
    total_seconds_downloading = program_size_mb / download_speed_mbps

    # L3
    seconds_per_hour = 3600 # WK
    total_hours_waiting = total_seconds_downloading / seconds_per_hour

    # FA
    answer = total_hours_waiting
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: We have to know how many MB are {program_size_gb}GB, {program_size_gb}GB x {mb_per_gb}MB/1GB = <<{program_size_mb}={program_size_mb}>>{program_size_mb} MB
The total seconds downloading will be {program_size_mb}MB / {download_speed_mbps}MB/second = <<{program_size_mb}/{download_speed_mbps}={total_seconds_downloading}>>{total_seconds_downloading} seconds
So she has to wait {total_seconds_downloading} seconds / {seconds_per_hour} seconds/1 hour = <<{total_seconds_downloading}/{seconds_per_hour}={total_hours_waiting}>>{total_hours_waiting} hours
